nl.uu.cs.ape.sat.constraints

Class Constraint_if_then_not_module

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.uu.cs.ape.sat.constraints.ConstraintTemplate
      • nl.uu.cs.ape.sat.constraints.Constraint_if_then_not_module

  • public class Constraint_if_then_not_module
extends ConstraintTemplate
    Implements constraints of the form:

    If we use module parameters[0], then do not use parameters[1] subsequently using the function getConstraint(java.lang.String[], nl.uu.cs.ape.sat.models.AllModules, nl.uu.cs.ape.sat.models.AllTypes, nl.uu.cs.ape.sat.automaton.ModuleAutomaton, nl.uu.cs.ape.sat.automaton.TypeAutomaton, nl.uu.cs.ape.sat.models.AtomMapping).
    Author:
    Vedran Kasalica

      Method will return a CNF representation of the constraint in DIMACS format.

    • Method Detail

      • getConstraint

        public java.lang.String getConstraint(java.lang.String[] parameters,
                                      AllModules allModules,
                                      AllTypes allTypes,
                                      ModuleAutomaton moduleAutomaton,
                                      TypeAutomaton typeAutomaton,
                                      AtomMapping mappings)
        Description copied from class: ConstraintTemplate
        Method will return a CNF representation of the constraint in DIMACS format. It will use predefined mapping function and all the atoms will be mapped to numbers accordingly.
        Specified by:
        getConstraint in class ConstraintTemplate
        Parameters:
        parameters - - array of input parameters
        allModules - - list of all the modules
        moduleAutomaton - - module automaton
        typeAutomaton - - type automaton
        mappings - - set of the mappings for the literals
        Returns:
        String CNF representation of the constraint. NULL in case of incorrect number of constraint parameters.
